newsitem.title: ZAIRE: U.S. envoy and Mobutu meet again.
newsitem.headline: U.S. envoy and Mobutu meet again.

text.p: U.S. envoy Bill Richardson held fresh talks with Zaire's President Mobutu Sese Seko on Wednesday as part of efforts to salvage a face-to-face meeting between the veteran strongman and rebel leader Laurent Kabila.
Witnesses and Zairean officials said the talks resumed in the capital Kinshasa at Mobutu's presidential villa in the heavily guarded Tshatshi military camp on the banks of the Zaire River.
Earlier, Kabila appealed to the international community to force Mobutu to attend talks at sea to avoid a battle for the teeming capital of five million people.

"We remain committed to the talks despite our military advantage but the international community must now put pressure on Mobutu and force him to come to talks at sea," Kabila told Reuters in Zaire's second city of Lubumbashi.

A diplomat travelling with Richardson said earlier that Mobutu, who had prostate cancer surgery in Europe in August, had turned down a South African offer to host the talks at sea off Zaire on one of its navy ships.
Kabila told Reuters on Wednesday that he would not go to Gabon, a venue preferred by Mobutu and encouraged by the United States, for security reasons.
The rebels control over half the sprawling Central African nation and are marching on Kinshasa.
